definition: lit. when a man achieves the Dao, his poultry and dogs rise to Heaven (idiom)/fig. to ride on sb else's success/Once one man gets a government position, all his cronies get in too/Once sb has cracked the problem, every Tom, Dick and Harry can do it
pinyin: yi1 ren2 de2 dao4 , ji1 quan3 sheng1 tian1

definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
dog/Kangxi radical 94
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
day/sky/heaven

lit. poultry and dogs rise to Heaven (idiom)/fig. to ride on sb else's success/Once one man gets a government position, all his cronies get in too/Once sb has cracked the problem, every Tom, Dick and Harry can do it
lit. If the upper beam is not straight, the lower beam will be crooked (idiom); fig. subordinates imitate their superiors' vices
pinyin: shang4 liang2 bu4 zheng4 xia4 liang2 wai1

definition: being close to the sovereign can be as perilous as lying with a tiger (idiom)
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
see 兔死狗烹[tu4 si3 gou3 peng1]
pinyin: jiao3 tu4 si3 zou3 gou3 peng1

definition: rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: to have reached the highest official positions
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
see 扳龍附鳳|扳龙附凤[ban1 long2 fu4 feng4]
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
subordinates follow the example of their superiors (idiom)
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
